instruction: phrase an email to my manager kindly asking for feedback for a dashboard I sent him for his use, and also ask him if I should publish this dashboard to the team, and if there's a certain way he wants me to publish it, or certain orientation to emphasis when publishing
output:
Subject: Request for Feedback and Guidance on the Dashboard

Dear [Manager's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to kindly ask for your feedback on the dashboard I have created for your use. As your assistant, I am always striving to improve my work and ensure that I am providing the most effective and useful tools for you and the team.

The dashboard in question is [briefly describe the dashboard and its purpose]. I believe it has the potential to be beneficial for our team, but I would greatly value your expert opinion. Your feedback will help me understand if I am on the right track and if there are any improvements or adjustments that need to be made.

In addition to your feedback, I would also like to inquire about the possibility of publishing this dashboard to the team. I think it could be a valuable resource for them, but I want to ensure that I do so in a way that aligns with our team's preferences and guidelines. 

If you approve of publishing the dashboard, I would be grateful for any guidance you can provide on the best way to do this. This could include the most appropriate method of sharing, the best time to publish, or any specific orientation or emphasis that would be most effective when presenting the dashboard to the team.

Thank you in advance for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing your thoughts and receiving your guidance on this matter.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
